section.title: Full RSA
section.p: Full RSA follows the same pattern: key generation and distribution, encryption, and decryption. Once again, the public key pair is to be distributed openly, and the private key is never to be distributed.

li.p: Choose two primes p and q, which for purpose of security should be
Compute \phi(n) = (p-1)(q-1) = n-(p+q-1). This is Euler's totient function.
Choose an integer e such that 1\lt e\lt \phi(n) and \gcd(e,\phi(n))=1.

statement.p: The public key is (n,e) and the private key is (n,d).

Suppose (n,e) is an RSA public key and (n,d) is the associated private key. For each integer m in an encoded message, the encrypted integer is
c(m) = m^e\text{ mod } n
and the decrypted message of a given c is
m(c) = c^d\text{ mod } n.

section.p: Reasonably secure RSA encryption requires the use of large primes requiring that the minimum bit-length be 1024 is not too small for security's sake. This in turn leads to very large n.
